classes.cCustomNote: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, B3, (B4 [lab] must be completed with either B2 or B3), C1, C2, C3, C4, C1-C5 elective, D1, D3, D4, D5 and F. C4, D5 and F should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). NO ECON FOR D5. Refer to online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP) and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: C3, C4, D1, D3, D4, D5 or F.
Any free elective can go here. Recommended: BUS100.

Concentration Declaration is due at this time.

20 units Approved Electives required. See catalog for course options. Consultation with an advisor is recommended prior to choosing approved electives. Courses in Analytics or in Statistics and Decision Analysis provide a focus in analytics. Courses in Statistics and Decision Analysis or in Mathematical Foundations are recommended for students pursuing post-baccalaureate studies. Economics majors cannot count ECON339 towards electives in the Quantitative concentration. Economics majors cannot count ECON395 or BUS392 or CSC101 towards electives in the Quantitative concentration.
